section.title: tm.ruri_matching
section.para: perform Request URI check in transaction matching.

section.title: tm.via1_matching
section.para: perform first Via header check in transaction matching.

section.title: tm.fr_timer
section.para: timer which hits if no final reply for a request or ACK for a negative INVITE reply arrives (in milliseconds).

section.title: tm.fr_inv_timer
section.para: timer which hits if no final reply for an INVITE arrives after a provisional message was received (in milliseconds).

section.title: tm.fr_inv_timer_next
section.para: The value [ms] of fr_inv_timer for subsequent branches during serial forking..

section.title: tm.wt_timer
section.para: time for which a transaction stays in memory to absorb delayed messages after it completed.

section.title: tm.delete_timer
section.para: time after which a to-be-deleted transaction currently ref-ed by a process will be tried to be deleted again..

section.title: tm.max_inv_lifetime
section.para: maximum time an invite transaction can live from the moment of creation.

section.title: tm.max_noninv_lifetime
section.para: maximum time a non-invite transaction can live from the moment of creation.

section.title: tm.noisy_ctimer
section.para: if set, INVITE transactions that time-out (FR INV timer) will be always replied.

section.title: tm.auto_inv_100_reason
section.para: reason text of the automatically send 100 to an INVITE.
Default value: trying -- your call is important to us.

section.title: tm.unix_tx_timeout
section.para: Unix socket transmission timeout, in milliseconds.

section.title: tm.restart_fr_on_each_reply
section.para: restart final response timer on each provisional reply.

section.title: tm.pass_provisional_replies
section.para: enable/disable passing of provisional replies to TMCB_LOCAL_RESPONSE_OUT callbacks.

section.title: tm.aggregate_challenges
section.para: if the final response is a 401 or a 407, aggregate all the authorization headers (challenges) (rfc3261 requires this to be on).

section.title: tm.unmatched_cancel
section.para: determines how CANCELs with no matching transaction are handled (0: statefull forwarding, 1: stateless forwarding, 2: drop).

section.title: tm.default_code
section.para: default SIP response code sent by t_reply(), if the function cannot retrieve its parameters.

section.title: tm.default_reason
section.para: default SIP reason phrase sent by t_reply(), if the function cannot retrieve its parameters.

section.title: tm.reparse_invite
section.para: if set to 1, the CANCEL and negative ACK requests are constructed from the INVITE message which was sent out instead of building them from the received request.

section.title: tm.ac_extra_hdrs
section.para: header fields prefixed by this parameter value are included in the CANCEL and negative ACK messages if they were present in the outgoing INVITE (depends on reparse_invite).

section.title: tm.blst_503
section.para: if set to 1, blacklist 503 SIP response sources.

section.title: tm.blst_503_def_timeout
section.para: default 503 blacklist time (in s), when no Retry-After header is present.

section.title: tm.blst_methods_add
section.para: bitmap of method types that trigger blacklisting on transaction timeouts.

section.title: tm.blst_methods_lookup
section.para: Bitmap of method types that are looked-up in the blacklist before statefull forwarding.

section.title: tm.cancel_b_method
section.para: How to cancel branches on which no replies were received: 0 - fake reply, 1 - retransmitting the request, 2 - send cancel.

section.title: tm.reparse_on_dns_failover
section.para: if set to 1, the SIP message after a DNS failover is constructed from the outgoing message buffer of the failed branch instead of from the received request.

section.title: tm.disable_6xx_block
section.para: if set to 1, 6xx is treated like a normal reply (breaks rfc).

section.title: tm.local_ack_mode
section.para: if set to 1 or 2, local 200 ACKs are sent to the same address as the corresponding INVITE (1) or the source of the 200 reply (2) instead of using the contact and the route set (it breaks the rfc, if it is not set to 0 but allows dealing with NATed contacts in some simple cases).

section.title: tm.local_cancel_reason
section.para: if set to 1, a Reason header is added to locally generated CANCELs (see RFC3326).

section.title: tm.e2e_cancel_reason
section.para: if set to 1, Reason headers from received CANCELs are copied into the corresponding generated hop-by-hop CANCELs.
